title: How to overcome impostor syndrome as a CS graduate - Quora

response.answer_text: My job involves training CS graduates when they’re newly hired by my company: they need to learn our tech stack and be generally indoctrinated in the culture and expectations. One thing I’ve learned is that “impostor syndrome” is rampant. But it’s not just in this young population: I’ve been in the industry > 35 years, and it’s rampant among the old folks too. Short and sweet: get a sense of humor and stop hiding that you think you’re a fraud. Most of us are frauds… that’s what drives us to keep learning and growing and being competitive. It is true that this represents a less-than-glowing internal daemon, but the attempt to “overcome” (or disguise) it produces side effects that are far worse than the creature itself. You’re human, it is OK to be imperfect and uncertain, you’re not hired for your heroic persona or magnificent mastery, you’re hired to participate in a team which serves a purpose. Tune into serving your purpose, and stop worrying so much about how you look in the mirror, and it all works out in time.
